Frame.Nav: Tilt-forward ROPS provides quick, easy access to internal components.
Front and rear Halogen floodlights provide better work-site visibility and safety.
Two excavator-style swing-away control levers provide enhanced precisions and easier exit/entry access to the operator environment.
The expanded line of buckets includes dirt, low-profile, manure/slurry and light material models of varying widths.
Case ride control reduces load/material spillage by stabilizing the load on rough job-site terrain.
At a mere 60 inches wide, the new XTs can fit through narrow openings.
The easy-to-clean swing-out oil cooler and new cross-flow radiator provide better cooling in extreme conditions.
Water-shedding seat prevents rain or melting snow from pooling in the seat.
Convenient swing-out engine door provides easy access to service points.
Optional catalytic muffler creates low emissions for operation in enclosed areas.
The optional battery quick disconnect and remote jump-start terminals are conveniently located.
The newly designed loader arms -- streamlined for better visibility -- help provide up to 7 Inches more forward reach over the 1800 series.
The optional automatic engine shutdown system protects from major damage if the machine reaches excessive temperatures or pressures.
The optional Case options-control panel is conveniently placed at eye level in front of the operator for easy access without restricting visibility.
A 4-inch longer wheel base than on 1800 series models provides stability and a smoother ride.
Optional two-way self-leveling - a forthcoming exclusive feature - will prevent material loss when raising or lowering loader arms.
With the same circumference as a 12x16.5 tire, the new 10x16.5 Galaxy Mighty Slim Jim tires available on the 60XT and 70XT help the machines fit into tight spaces.
An optional hydraulic attachment quick coupler on all XT models makes it possible to conveniently drop and switch buckets directly from the operator's compartment.
